starvationevasion.sim

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by winston on 1/23/15. Phase_01 CS 351 spring 2015
    The world is everything that is the case. The world is the totality of facts, not of things. The facts in logical space are the world.
    - L. W.

    • Method Detail

      • makeWorld

        public static void makeWorld(java.util.Collection<GeographicArea> world,
                             java.util.Collection<Territory> territories,
                             TileManager allTheLand,
                             java.util.Calendar cal)
        This method is used to create the world object. The world object is a singleton class, there is one and only one world.
        Parameters:
        world - the list of geographic areas that make up the world.
        territories - the political entities in the world
        cal - the starting date of the world.

      • getWorld

        public static World getWorld()
        used to return the world to singleton design pattern.
        Returns:
        the world

      • getCurrentDate

        public java.util.Calendar getCurrentDate()
        Get the current time of this particular world.
        Returns:
        a calendar object, with the date and time in side.

        Parameters:

      • getAllTiles

        public java.util.Collection<LandTile> getAllTiles()
        Returns:
        a Collection holding all the LandTiles in the world, including those not assigned to regions and those without data

      • dataTiles

        public java.util.List<LandTile> dataTiles()
        Returns a Collection of the tiles held by this TileManager that actually contain data. This, in effect, excludes tiles that would be over ocean and those at the extremes of latitude. For all tiles, use allTiles();
        Returns:
        a Collection holding only those tiles for which there exists raster data.

      • getAllCountrifiedTiles

        public java.util.Collection<LandTile> getAllCountrifiedTiles()
        Returns:
        a Collection of all the tiles registered with Countries.

      • setTileManager

        public void setTileManager(TileManager mgr)
        Set the TileManager for the World
        Parameters:
        mgr - TileManager to set to this World

      • getTile

        public LandTile getTile(double lon,
                        double lat)
        Return the LandTile containing given longitude and latitude coordinates. See TileManager.getTile()
        Parameters:
        lon - longitude of coord
        lat - latitude of coord
        Returns:
        LandTile containing the coordinates
